description: Construction of 3rd floor level and the change of use of the building from office (B1) to a retail shop at the ground floor and 14 flats split over the first , second and third levels with 6 car parking spaces (including 1 loading bay), refuse storage, cycle storage and a green living roof and energy generation on site (Revised Scheme)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  The development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the details submitted on Dwg No. 6 Rev G no work shall take place on the site until full details of both hard and soft landscaping works have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and completed prior to the occupation of the units and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of the prospective residents and neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The retail use hereby permitted within the ground-floor of the building shall not operate outside the hours of 0600 - 2300hrs Monday to Saturday, and 0700 - 2230 hrs on Sundays and Bank or Public Holidays.  Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties in accordance with policies 4.4 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | The car parking spaces and associated access areas including the disabled parking bays and loading bays shown on the approved plan shall be formed, marked out on the site and available for use prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and these spaces shall be kept continuously respectively available for car parking or servicing of shops, and shall not be used for any other purpose.  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking and servicing, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | The cycle parking shown on the approved plans shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To provide and retain adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall take place until details of servicing and refuse and recycling collection arrangements have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include a refuse management plan that prevents occupants from siting at any time refuse and/or recycling bins on any road frontage.  Refuse and recycling collection shall not take place between the hours of 2200 and 0700 on any day.  The approved arrangements shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any of the development hereby approved, and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To ensure suitable loading, unloading and refuse collection arrangements are provided within the site in order to ensure pedestrian and highway safety and to protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and the visual amenities of the locality, in accordance with policies 2.10 and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 'Refuse and Recycling Facilities'. | Details of measures for protecting the building envelope (roof, walls and windows) of the residential units from external noise, vibration and odour, including aircraft noise and internal separation between the ground floor retail unit and the residential units, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  The works shall be carried out as approved before first occupation and shall thereafter be retained.  REASON: To protect the amenities and the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential units, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, to demonstrate that the rating noise level received in gardens, balconies and at facades of sensitive facades, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, will be lower than the existing background noise level determined to be 45dB LA90 by at least 5 dBA at 3.5 m into the residential unit from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade.  REASON: To protect the amenities and the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential units, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the commencement of construction, to demonstrate that the rating noise level emitted from the proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.  REASON.  In the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site and neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 4.11 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment) 2004 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 "Noise and Development". | The development hereby approved shall comply with the aims and objectives of the Police requirements of Secured By Design. These works shall be carried out prior to the first occupation of the development, and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To ensure that the development achieves the required crime prevention elements and to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policy 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8: Safer Ealing. | No windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in any of the walls or roof of the building permitted and the proposed windows on the northern elevation for the residential units shall remain permanently fixed'. Further, the proposed lourve windows on the rear (southern) elevation shall be maintained in perpetuity.  REASON: To protect the privacy and living conditions of neighbouring residential occupiers in Broomfield Road and the living conditions of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No external access shall be gained to the top of the building or to the third floor balconies except for the purposes of essential servicing and maintenance and for no other purpose. Further, no additional plant, air conditioning or satellite dishes shall be erected on any part of the roof of the approved building, except with the prior written permission of the local planning authority.  REASON: To protect the privacy, outlook and living conditions of neighbouring properties and to preserve the visual appearance of the area in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The applicant shall submit details of the proposed lourves to be located on the rear elevation of the proposed building before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  The development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The proposed residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to lifetime homes standards prior to the first occupation of any part of the development and thereafter retained.  Reason: To ensure access for all future occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004); Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) 7: Accessible Ealing . | The retail unit hereby approved shall not be subdivided or otherwise altered so that the net floor area of the shop is decreased, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the servicing implications of the alterations can be assessed by the Local Planning Authority, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.8 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) | Details of energy efficient design and consideration of on-site equipment for renewable power generation for the buildings so that at least 10% of all energy requirements within the resulting development are sourced from renewable energy resources, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any of the development and shall be permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To ensure that the development incorporates energy efficiency measures, in accordance with policy 2.9 of adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
